title: Market Research for Longer Divide
description: China’s threshold for the death penalty in certain corruption and embezzlement cases is deliberately low by global standards because their legal system treats “large-scale corruption” as both an economic and political threat. The “especially serious circumstances” clause means that even amounts just above that line can be death-eligible if prosecutors argue there was extensive damage to public trust, national projects, or social stability.
